sections.heading: Terms, defined.For purposes of the Student Discipline Act, unless the context otherwise requires:(1) Long-term suspension means the exclusion of a student from attendance in all schools within the system for a period exceeding five school days but less than twenty school days;(2) Expulsion means exc
sections.text: Terms, defined.For purposes of the Student Discipline Act, unless the context otherwise requires:(1) Long-term suspension means the exclusion of a student from attendance in all schools within the system for a period exceeding five school days but less than twenty school days;(2) Expulsion means exclusion from attendance in all schools within the system in accordance with section 79-283;(3) Mandatory reassignment means the involuntary transfer of a student to another school; and(4) Short-term suspension means the exclusion of a student from attendance in all schools within the system for a period not to exceed five school days.SourceLaws 1976, LB 503, § 10;Laws 1994, LB 1250, § 15;R.S.1943, (1994), § 79-4,179;Laws 1996, LB 900, § 60;Laws 1997, LB 232, § 1;Laws 2023, LB705, § 62.
